result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremiah J Dawson

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

(9:34 AM case called.) Defendant Jeremiah J Dawson does not appear in court or via Zoom. Attorney Elizabeth C. Grabow appeared by video for Jeremiah J Dawson. Prosecuting attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Grabow indicates the defendant contacted her this morning advising his ride fell through. Defendant was provided with the Zoom information.
State has no objection to rescheduling.
Status Conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 8:30 am in person, Attorney Grabow may appear via Zoom if provides written notice to the Court.
Status conference on August 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Case called at 10:41 AM. Hearing held via Zoom and in person.
Prosecuting Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Jeremiah J Dawson in court.  Attorney Elizabeth C. Grabow appeared by video for Jeremiah J Dawson. 
Defendant waives his right to Preliminary Hearing. State to file identical Information. Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas. 
Branch 1 to schedule STC.

10:16 AM Prosecuting attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jeremiah J Dawson in court.  Attorney Elizabeth C. Grabow appeared by video for Jeremiah J Dawson. Attorney Grabow was just appointed. PTC: 04/13/22 at 2:30pm.
Hearing scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 09:30 am.
